availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Theophilus T. Garrard (Clay County soldier, general (U.S.A.) )

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Clay county native. Married to Lucy B. Lee. Father of Joseph Garrard, Gilbert Garrard, Isabella Garrard, Mary Garrard, Kate Garrard, Sophia Garrard, and Daniel Garrard. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1843 to 1844. Captain in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.). Mexican-American War veteran. Commissioner of the Kentucky Union Railway Company in 1854. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1857 to 1861. Farmer in Clay County in 1860. Colonel in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from September 22, 1861, to November 24,, 1862. Brigadier General from November 24, 1862, to April 4, 1864. Owned six enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
